entry.title: Armenia should priortize diversification of energy and other areas to avoid dependence

media:group.media:title: Armenia should priortize diversification of energy and other areas to avoid dependence
media:group.media:description:
Ambassador James Warlick, a former U.S. co-chair to the OSCE Minsk Group, a body set up in the 1990s to work toward a negotiated settlement of the Nagorno-Karabakh conflict, talked to CivilNet about the current state of the group. Warlick discussed Washingtonโs engagement in the region, the impact of tensions between the West and Russia on the Minsk Group, and the United Statesโ recognition of Armeniaโs vital security arrangements with the Kremlin.

entry.title: 30 years of saving thousands of Armenians from preventable blindness

media:group.media:title: 30 years of saving thousands of Armenians from preventable blindness
media:group.media:description:
The Armenian Eyecare Project is a non-profit that has been working for three decades to provide eye care to thousands of Armenians, as well as to increase public education and capacity building in the country. Dr. Roger Ohanesian, an ophthalmologist from California and the president of the Armenian Eyecare Project, spoke to CivilNet about how the organizationโs work has changed since its founding in 1992, his future plans for the project and what inspired him to take on the endeavor.
